comment: Given a subset of multidimensional reals and a set of half-open intervals that covers it, the Lebesgue outer measure of the set is bounded by the generalized sum of the pre-measure of the half-open intervals. The statement would also be true with ` X ` the empty set, but covers are not used for the zero-dimensional case. (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Oct-2020.)
